content: Yes, it is possible to forgive someone without an apology from the other person. An apology from the offender can be helpful in the forgiveness process, as it can show their remorse and willingness to make amends. However, forgiveness ultimately comes from within oneself, and it is a personal decision that can be made regardless of whether the offender apologizes or not. In some instances, the offender may be unable or unwilling to apologize, or they may have already passed away. In these cases, seeking closure and forgiveness can still be achieved through self-reflection, counseling, and other forms of personal growth and healing.
